required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Anthracyclines and Cyclophosphamide on Cardiovascular Responses
clinical_study.official_title: Chronic Effect of Doxorubicin and Cyclophosphamide on Neurovascular Control and Blood Pressure in Women in Adjuvant Treatment for Breast Neoplasia

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

clinical_study.source: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The present study aims to investigate the chronic effect of treatment with doxorubicin and cyclophosphamide on neurovascular control and blood pressure in women undergoing adjuvant treatment for breast cancer.

detailed_description.textblock:
The development of new drugs and different adjuvant therapeutic regimens, based on the combination of anthracycline (A) and cyclophosphamide (C), have contributed greatly to improve survival rate in breast cancer patients. Despite the clinical benefits of this therapy, AC treatment can cause cardiovascular acute and chronic changes. In a recent investigation, we observed that an acute AC chemotherapy session increases sympathetic nervous activity and blood pressure in patients with breast cancer.
The present study aims to investigate the chronic effects of AC regimen on sympathetic nervous activity, peripheral vasoconstriction, endothelial microparticles and blood pressure, in women with breast cancer.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 15-20 days after the end of AC regimen
primary_outcome.description: Change in muscular sympathetic nerve activity measured by microneurography

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 15-20 days after the end of AC regimen
secondary_outcome.description: Change in muscle blood flow measured by venous oclusion plethysmography

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 15-20 days after the and of AC regimen
secondary_outcome.description: Change in blood pressure measured by finometer

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 15-20 days after the end of AC regimen
secondary_outcome.description: Change in physical capacity measured by cardiopulmonary exercise test

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 15-20 days after the end of AC regimen
secondary_outcome.description: Change in cardiac function measured by echocardiography

arm_group.description: The patients will be assessed before and after chemotherapy treatment.

intervention.description: Body weight, height and waist circumference

Serum and Plasma will be extracted by centrifugation. Endothelial microparticles by flow cytometry Interleukin-6 and tumor necrosis factor Î± by ELISA, High-sensitive reactive serum C-reactive protein by immunoturbidimetric assay, NT- ProBNP According to Central Laboratory, Hospital das Clinicas, HCFMUSP, Faculdade de Medicina, Universidade de Sao Paulo. Endothelin-1 by immunoenzymatic method Nitric oxide by gas chemiluminescence Lipoperoxidation by fluorimetry Carbonyl by spectrophotometer, and Superoxide Dismutase (SOD) by colorimetry.
Four session of intravenous (in bolus) infusion of doxorubicin 60mg/m2 and cyclophosphamide 600mg/m2 with an interval of 21 days between sessions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diagnosis of stage II-III breast cancer
- starting adjuvant chemotherapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- metastatic disease,
- hypercholesterolemia, diabetes,
- hypertension,
- severe lymphedema,
- organic disorders (renal failure, heart failure and chronic liver disease),
- obesity (BMI> 30) and,
- who are under pharmacological treatment with statins, angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors, losartan potassium, beta blockers or antioxidants

overall_official.affiliation: Instituto do Coracao, HCFMUSP, Faculdade de Medicina, Universidade de Sao Paulo

facility.name: Instituto do Coracao (InCor), Hospital das Clinicas HCFMUSP, Faculdade de Medicina, Universidade de Sao Paulo
